title: THE DESIGNER - CREATIVE CAREER THROUGH BOOM AND BUST (2002-2013)
description: From graphic designer at Kopybasa through the housing bubble burst and Spain's deepest economic crisis

timeline.description: Started professional career in graphic design and printing
Mastered design tools, print production, client relations during economic boom
Print industry thriving, high demand for marketing materials during housing boom
Financial crisis severely impacts print and design industry, clients cut budgets
Adapting to reduced demand, learning to do more with less
After 9 years, time for a new chapter
Spain at 25% unemployment, planning entrepreneurial leap
Launched own creative agency in the middle of Spain's worst crisis

skillsAcquired: Adobe Creative Suite mastery (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)

phases.name: The Boom
phases.description: Spain builds 800,000 homes/year, more than France, Germany, and UK combined. Easy credit, speculation, and 'brick economy' dominate.

phases.name: The Crash
phases.description: Lehman Brothers collapses, credit freezes, housing bubble bursts. Spain enters its worst recession. Unemployment skyrockets.

phases.name: The Austerity
phases.description: European debt crisis, bank bailout, severe austerity measures. 6 million unemployed. Youth exodus (brain drain).

governments.name: Jose Luis Rodriguez Zapatero (PSOE)
governments.context: Managed the crisis onset, denied it initially

keyEvents.description: 192 people killed in coordinated terrorist attacks, 3 days before general election; changed political landscape
Spain building more houses than any EU country; prices doubling every 5 years; mortgage frenzy
Global financial crisis triggers Spain's housing bubble burst; credit markets freeze overnight
Bond yields spike, EU questions Spain's solvency; first austerity measures introduced
Spain requests 41.3 billion EUR EU bailout for banking sector; unemployment reaches 25%; mass protests

printIndustryImpact.title: Print & Design Industry During the Crisis
printIndustryImpact.description: The graphic design and print industry was devastated by the economic crisis

companiesClosed.description: Over 30% of print shops closed between 2008-2013

digitalShift.description: Digital advertising surpassed print advertising by 2012

funFacts: At the peak, Spain was building more homes per year than Germany, France, and UK combined
The phrase 'Spain is different' took on a grim new meaning during the crisis
Banks offered 110% mortgages - lending more than the home was worth
The word 'mileurista' (earning 1000 EUR/month) became the symbol of a generation
Ghost towns of empty apartments became the visual icon of the bubble burst
During the boom, everyone joked that Spain had more cranes than the rest of Europe
The print industry went from 'we need it yesterday' rush jobs to crickets practically overnight
Adobe Creative Suite went from a luxury to a survival tool for freelance designers
